results.title: Crossing the Great Sagrada
results.creator_credit: Adrian Brunel, Lionel Rich, All-Britisch Productions and Priceless Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1924, during one of the periodic slumps in the British film industry, Adrian Brunel amused himself and many others by producing a series of burlesques. This film tells of Holmes, Sweet and Holmes’ voyage by sea to Africa where they then set off, on camels, across the desert to finally arrive at the famous Cascara of Sagrada falls. A comic travel film of the silent era.

results.title: Cross your heart and hope to live
results.creator_credit: Bert Christensen and Danish Heart Foundation
results.brief_description: Looks at the rising incidence of heart disease in Western society. Of babies born with perfect arteries, by the age of 15 virtually everybody has ruined them to some extent. Points out that the “good life” is responsible - smoking, lack of physical activity, excess fatty substances in the blood, high blood pressure and overweight are to blame. Suggestions are made for overcoming the problem.

results.title: Crofter boy
results.creator_credit: Stanley Russell and Thames and Clyde Film Company
results.brief_description: The life, education and activities of crofter children against the impressive background of the Scottish highlands. Shows how the coming of electricity to the crofters’ homes, the development of local industries and the mechanisation of agriculture, are gradually changing the traditional pattern of life. Local school-children at Gairloch and Poolwe in Western Ross appear in the film, with Kenneth Mackenzie, a crofter’s son, as the main character. Commentary by James McKechnie.

results.title: Crocodile hunters
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: In the rivers and billabongs of Northern Territory small fresh-water crocodiles are traditionally hunted using spear and canoe. But, in recent years, a new industry has become established in these regions - the hunting of the crocodile for his skin, which brings a high price in the south when manufactured into hand-bags, shoes, wallets and ornaments. Teams of hunters make their camps by the rivers and estuaries where fresh-water and salt-water varieties are found. Photography by Frank Bagnall.

results.brief_description: A satirical look at the eternal triangle of the art world - the artist, the audience and the critic. The arrogance of Criticus, the critic, infuriates both the musician and his audience, and a friend of the performer decides to get rid of the nuisance. However, it is not as easy as he thinks.

results.title: Critical path in use
results.creator_credit: Sam Napier-Bell and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: In planning a new undertaking, a chart is made to show each move as a separate step in an integral plan. This technique helps to solve many problems on paper before they occur in practice. Shows the drawing up after discussion of a Critical Path Analysis for work on a major project. The advantages of the system for all units are emphasised, and reference is made to the British export effort.

results.title: Julia: critical moments in teaching (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Gliessman, Don G. Williams, Calvin Productions and United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare
results.brief_description: Julia, a naturally retiring child, becomes withdrawn in class. The school psychologist tests her and finds she has a hearing impairment. He recommends keeping Julia in her present class. Her teacher is suddenly confronted with the realisation that she has primary responsibility for Julia’s education. What steps should she take to help her?
